text: The White Cat
Once upon a time, there was a haunted palace.
No one who went in...ever come out again.
A white cat lived inside the palace.
At night, she sang a sad song.
Through the night, When stars are bright, Won't you come to see me?
Through the night, When stars are bright, Won't you come to see me?
All the villagers talked about the haunted palace.
"Who lives there?" asked a girl.
"A witch lives there," said a woman.
"A ghost lives there," said a man.
"No," said an old woman.
"A white cat lives there.
But the cat is really Princess Isabel."
"The cat is really Princess Isabel?" asked the girl.
"That's right," said the old woman.
"A wizard turned her into a cat."
"Poor Princess Isabel!" said the girl.

Then the girl told her friends, who told their friends, who told others, 
and so it was that the sad story spread throughout the land.
One day, a man named Marcos heard about Princess Isabel.
"I'm going to help her," he said.
Marcos took his sword and rode to the palace gates.
The old woman stood near them.
"Be careful," she said.
"The wizard is waiting."
The palace gates opened with a creak.
Marcos went inside. Skeletons lay along the walls.
"Isabel?" asked Marcos.
Suddenly, the evil wizard appeared.
"Ha, ha, ha. Isabel is mine," he said.
Marcos drew his sword.
"Let her go," he said.
"Swords can't kill me," said the wizard.
Then the wizard turned into a red dragon.
The dragon flew toward him, and Marcos fell from his horse.
'I've got you now," said the dragon, and opened its mouth to eat him.
Suddenly, Isabel jumped up onto the dragon's head and covered its eyes!
"Let him go!" she yelled.
The dragon shook its head and the cat fell to the ground.
"I'll kill you!" yelled the wizard, and he chased Isabel.
"Swords can't kill the wizard!" said Isabel.
But Marcos swung his sword into the dragon's neck.
The dragon turned into 10 black vultures.
"You'll never beat me," said the voice of the wizard from inside the vultures.
The vultures flew toward Marcos and Isabel.
"Fight him with fire!" yelled Isabel.
Marcos took a burning torch and swung it into the vultures.
"No!" yelled the wizard.
One by one, the vultures turned into burning rocks and fell to the ground.
"Fight him with water!" yelled Isabel.
Marcos pushed over a big water jar, and the water washed over all the rocks.
"Nooooo...!" screamed the wizard, but his voice faded away.
Steam rose from the black rocks.
The cat turned back inti Princess Isabel.
"The wizard is gone!" she said.
"You're free!" said Marcos.
Marcos and Isabel threw the rocks into the sea, and that is where the wizard stayed.

After that, Marcos became the king, and Isabel became the queen, 
and they lived happily ever after.
